DOCUMENT 58
ELECTRONICALLY FILED
10/29/2024 4:30 PM
70-DR-2023-900051.01
CIRCUIT COURT OF
TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
PATRICK CRADDOCK, CLERK
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
CHRISTOPHER BLAINE MCGREGOR,
Respondent,
v.
CASE NO.: 70-DR-2023-900051.01
BRITTANY MICHELLE GILLILAND,
Petitioner.
MOTION FOR PENDENTE LITE HEARING
COMES NOW, Petitioner-Mother BRITTANY GILLILAND, by and through the
undersigned counsel of record, Barbara H. Agricola, with the law firm of Agricola Law, LLC, and
hereby moves this Honorable Court for a Pendente Lite Hearing. In support thereof, Petitioner
states as follows:
1. Parties appeared before this Honorable Court for a Show Cause Hearing on July 31,
2024 and announced an agreement on record regarding the terms for reunification
therapy for the Minor Child A.K. and Mother, co-parenting, family dinners, and joint
counselling sessions. A joint proposed order was to be filed based on the announced
agreement;
2. At the time of this filing, the Parties have been unable to reach an agreement on the
proposed order following this hearing. This is clearly a delay tactic on the Father’s
behalf to continue alienating the Minor Child, A.K., from Mother. Both parties have
filed proposed orders in this action and no reunification therapy or joint counseling
sessions have been initiated due to Father’s antics;
3. Father has significantly pushed back against Mother regarding reunification therapy
and prohibited Minor Child, A.K., from attending sessions with Mother. See Exhibit
Brittany Michelle Gilliland v. Christopher Blaine McGregor
Circuit Court of Tallapoosa County, Alabama
Case No.: 70-DR-2023-900051.01
Motion for Pendente Lite Hearing
Page 1 of 4
DOCUMENT 58
A, text correspondence between Father, Mother, and Kelly Turner, a reunification
therapist;
4. Father has willfully ignored this Honorable Court’s instruction to the Parties in open
court on July 31, 2024 and blocked Mother’s attempt at receiving school documents.
See Exhibit B, Respondent-Father’s text correspondence to Mother informing her that
he will instruct Minor Children’s teachers to not send documents home with Mother;
5. Father has recently filed for Chapter 13 bankruptcy and verbally expressed to Mother
that he has done so in order to delay his required alimony payments to Mother, posing
a significant financial impact on her monthly income. Father has also contacted the
Department of Human Resources to garnish Mother’s wages for child support. See
Exhibit C, Father’s text correspondence with Mother explaining that he will be
garnishing Mother’s wages and Exhibit D, letter received from DHR;
6. On October 10, 2024, while Mother was on the phone with A.K., Father interrupted the
conversation to degrade Mother in front of Minor Child A.K., using profane language
and name-calling. Father began using obscene and sexual language in front of both
Minor Children while still on the phone with Mother, stating that Mother was “rubbing
buttholes together” with her boyfriend. Mother filed a police report to document this
incident in an attempt to prevent Father from interfering with Mother’s communication
with Minor Children;
7. Further, Father has continued to use harassing communications to Mother and people
associated with Mother. Father has contacted Mother’s boyfriend’s ex-wife in an
attempt to cause further drama and turmoil within Mother’s life and portray her in a
negative light. Father is spreading rumors and lies about Mother’s parenting and
Brittany Michelle Gilliland v. Christopher Blaine McGregor
Circuit Court of Tallapoosa County, Alabama
Case No.: 70-DR-2023-900051.01
Motion for Pendente Lite Hearing
Page 2 of 4
DOCUMENT 58
behavior towards Minor Children to manipulate the Minor Children and Mother’s
family and friends in an attempt to turn them against her. See Exhibit E, text messages
with Father and Mother’s partner’s ex-wife;
8. Father is in willful contempt of this Honorable Court’s announced agreement made in
Court on July 31, 2024 and has been consistently interfering with Mother’s
communication with Minor Children, specifically A.K., using degrading and obscene
language to Mother in front of Minor Children, alienating Mother from school-related
activities;
9. Further, a recalculation of child support is in order as Mother has lost a significant
portion of her income due to Father filing for bankruptcy and ceasing alimony
payments.
10. Mother has incurred attorney’s fees due to Father’s contempt and has been forced to
take legal action as a result.
WHEREFORE, PREMISES CONSIDERED, Mother respectfully requests that the
Court set this matter for a Pendente Lite Hearing at the earliest available docket and grant the
following relief:
1. GRANT Mother’s motion and set this matter for a pendente lite hearing.
2. Find Father in contempt of this Honorable Court’s announced agreement.
3. Impose appropriate sanctions to Father to compel compliance with the Parties’ July
agreement announced on the record.
4. ORDER that Father pay Mother’s attorney’s fees as a result of Father’s contempt.
5. GRANT to Mother such other and further relief as the Court deems just, proper,
and to which in equity and good conscience she may be entitled.
Brittany Michelle Gilliland v. Christopher Blaine McGregor
Circuit Court of Tallapoosa County, Alabama
Case No.: 70-DR-2023-900051.01
Motion for Pendente Lite Hearing
Page 3 of 4
DOCUMENT 58
Respectfully submitted on October 29, 2024.
/s/ Barbara H. Agricola (AGR004)
Attorney for Mother
OF COUNSEL:
AGRICOLA LAW
127 South 8th Street
Opelika, Alabama 36801
Telephone: 334.759.7557
Facsimile: 334.759.7558
barbara@agricolalaw.com
www.agricolalaw.com

electronic filing in the AlaCourt E-File System and/or by placing same in an envelope, properly
addressed, and depositing it in the United States Mail, with adequate postage prepaid on October
29, 2024.
Tom F. Young, Jr.
Attorney for Father
Morris Haynes LLP
131 Main Street
Alexander City, Alabama 35010
